title: Not able to debug/run tests in all IDEs
body:
I am using Quarkus 2.2.2.Final for a project and having issues to run unit tests marked as `QuarkusTest` from IDEs (IntelliJ, Eclipse and VSCode). Everything works just fine from command line using maven.

With IntelliJ, when I run the class hosting the unit tests, I got a generic

```shell
java: Compilation failed: internal java compiler error
```

The only way to workaround this, as suggested by @metacosm is enabling `Delegate IDE build/run actions to Maven` in Build, Execution, Deployment > Build Tools > Maven > Runner settings. It was long time that I run these unit test and I remember that I didn't need that workaround before updating to 2.x version.

In VSCode so even in Eclipse (some colleagues of mine), we got a more explicit:

```shell
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.RuntimeException: io.quarkus.builder.BuildException: Build failure: Build failed due to errors

 [error]: Build step io.quarkiverse.operatorsdk.deployment.OperatorSDKProcessor#createConfigurationServiceAndOperator threw an exception: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: io.quarkus.deployment.util.JandexUtil$ClassNotIndexedException

 at io.quarkus.deployment.util.JandexUtil.resolveTypeParameters(JandexUtil.java:74)

 at io.quarkiverse.operatorsdk.deployment.OperatorSDKProcessor.createControllerConfiguration(OperatorSDKProcessor.java:270)
```

Are there any settings for having Quarkus run/debug unit tests back working in IDEs?
